p: First records of dengue in Kenya are from 1982, when there was a large outbreak caused by DENV-2 in the coastal area involving the cities of Kilifi and Malindi. The seroprevalence in the outbreak area was 52% after the outbreak [ 8]. In 2013 an outbreak caused by DENV-2 occurred in Mombasa. From this outbreak three DENV-2 isolates were obtained and sequenced [ 9], followed by ten strains of cosmopolitan genotype DENV-2 obtained from patient samples collected in 2014â€“2015 in Kilifi [ 10]. Again in 2017 an outbreak occurred in Malindi, where ten strains of related cosmopolitan genotype DENV-2 were isolated [ 11] demonstrating sustained DENV-2 circulation in Kenya.
